ARABIC: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They have denied the truth, but the news of what they mocked will certainly come to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They will soon come to know the truth of that which they have been scoffing at.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They have called (our revelation) lies. They will soon learn the consequences of what they mocked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed they have denied, so now soon coming upon them are the tidings of what they used to scoff at.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, they have indeed denied, then the news of what they mocked at will come to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So they have indeed rejected (the truth), therefore the news of that which they mock shall soon come to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So they have cried lies; therefore assuredly tidings will come to them of that they mocked at.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Now they have denied (the Truth); but there will come unto them tidings of that whereat they used to scoff.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they have indeed rejected the message. But the truth of what they laughed to scorn will dawn upon them before long.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So they have surely belied; wherefore anon there shall come unto them the truth of that whereat they were wont to mock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They have already denied [the truth], but soon there will come to them the news of what they have been deriding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So they have indeed denied (the truth - this Quran), then the news of what they mocked at, will come to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So, they belied, but surely the tidings of that they mocked will come to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They have denied the truth, but soon will come to them the news of what they ridiculed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:6] Verily then they have denied, it; but soon there will come to them the news, the consequences, of that which they used to deride.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Now they have denied) Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an; (but there will come unto them tidings) the news (of that whereat they used to scoff) of chastisement; it is also said that this means: there will come to them the news of their derision of Muhammad (pbuh) and of the Qur'an.
